intro: Paronychia drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy, herbaceous plants. The plant features delicate, yellow flowers with five petals and a hairy stem that often grows in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a rough texture and a distinctive, waxy appearance. Paronychia drummondii is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
